name: DV_IDENTIFIER
title: DV_IDENTIFIER
description:
Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities. Typical identifiers include drivers licence number, social security number, veterans affairs number, prescription id, order id, and so on.

DV_IDENTIFIER is used to represent any identifier of a real thing, issued by some authority or agency. 

Misuse: DV_IDENTIFIER is not used to express identifiers generated by the infrastructure to refer to information items; the types OBJECT_ID and OBJECT_REF and subtypes are defined for this purpose.

element.short: Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities.
element.definition:
Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities. Typical identifiers include drivers licence number, social security number, veterans affairs number, prescription id, order id, and so on.

DV_IDENTIFIER is used to represent any identifier of a real thing, issued by some authority or agency. 

Misuse: DV_IDENTIFIER is not used to express identifiers generated by the infrastructure to refer to information items; the types OBJECT_ID and OBJECT_REF and subtypes are defined for this purpose.

constraint.human: Issuer valid must not be empty
Assigner valid must not be empty
Id valid must not be empty
Type valid must not be empty

element.short: Optional authority which issues the kind of id used in the id field of this object.
element.definition: Optional authority which issues the kind of id used in the id field of this object.

element.short: Optional organisation that assigned the id to the item being identified.
element.definition: Optional organisation that assigned the id to the item being identified.
The identifier value. Often structured, according to the definition of the issuing authority's rules.

element.short: Optional identifier type, such as  prescription , or  Social Security Number .
element.definition: Optional identifier type, such as  prescription , or  Social Security Number . One day a controlled vocabulary might be possible for this.
